Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: katootjeBelgium
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located to visit Istanbul: at 5 minutes walking distance from Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar. Very friendly staff and clean but very small rooms. Breakfast is OK but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Arena Hotel, April 2012”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: Nice little Hotel, very well located close to the historical attractions; the room,we had, was small, but cosy and clean. Very friendly staff! We really can recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Peggy L
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Arena hotel after our 14-day Mediterranean Cruise. Our travel agent highly recommended the Arena Hotel to fully appreciate the culture of the city--and she was right! The hotel was upscale with a high-class charm that made us feel right at home. We thoroughly enjoyed the convenience of the on-site "Delight" restaurant. The staff accommodated our every need and we would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jo-Ann P
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel. It is a charming hotel, great value and is perfectly located very near (three minute walk) some of Istanbul's most famous attractions, Most importantly, we felt like family. Every staff member was helpful and attentive to us. They gave us many travel tips which enabled us to maximixe our limited time in this wonderful city. Breakfast included and a feast!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Staff, Great Location, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeanaGeft
Reviews.Content: I returned yesterday evening after an eight night stay at the Arena. Unur (not sure of the spelling) greeted us immediately upon entering the building, seating us and bringing tea and cookies. The check-in was efficient and ended with a quick over view of the sights in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. Each day, he would help with best transportation and general logistics of getting around the city. I wish I had another week to continue exploring an amazing city. The hotel was comfortable, with tremendous character, convenient to most historic sights and public transportation. Wonderful staff that made my stay memorable. Unur had the patience to deal with all my requests with graceful attention. Would unreservedly give five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars service for bed and breakfast price”
Reviews.Author: Farina4763
Reviews.Content: I arrived early in the morning, and they give me the room straightaway, no need to wait for the check in time which is usually 12 pm. Plus they offer me a breakfast on the arrival date! Usually breakfast is for the next morning. I stayed at the Arena hotel for 8 nights and enjoy every bit of traditional Turkish hospitality from all of the hotel member. The hotel is small but cozy and tidy. All amenities are provided, from bath robe, slippers, towel set, coffee/tea pot and replenished coffee and tea stock everyday, minibar, and safe box. Free wifi is also available from my room. Full buffet breakfast with egg, coffee, cappucino, hot chocolate, milk, tea, juices, yoghurt, cheeses, all sort of meat, bread and pastry, nuts, etc. What more you would expect? They even have the Turkish bath. All staff are friendly and very helpful. Special thanks to Faruk who accompanied me to shop at Spice Bazaar and Grand Bazaar, help me in bargaining so that I spent less money, explained how to brew Turkish's coffee using Ibrik, and boiled Turkish's tea, lend me a proper camera, allow me to use his Istanbulkart to get on the public transportation cheaper (sometimes 50% less than normal fares) on tram, furnikuler, metro subway and ferry. Location wise, it's perfect. Less than 30 minutes by taxi from the Ataturk International airport. My suggestion is that you ask an airport pick up from the hotel. For only 20 euros you are free from worrying to find the hotel location. The hotel is located in Sultanahmet area where most of the tourist interests are: the marvelous Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Hippodrome, Tohkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar. And if you want to go to Taksim, tram station is in this location as well. I walked in the beautiful area everyday and never get enough. Sultanahmet area is good for walk, but you need to wear a comfortable shoes, high heels are a no no. There are 3 kofte restaurants near the Sultanahmet (Blue Mosque) tram station. Choose the one in the middle for the most delicious kofte. Kofte is a grilled minced beef, one among many Turkish's great culinaries. For coffee lovers, try Turk's coffee at Kahve Dunyasi which are available throughout Istanbul, and there is one in the Sultanahmet area. The coffee is served with chocolate covered cofee bean which is crunchy. The cafe itself, Kahve Dunyasi, is a unique blend of coffee and chocolatiers. I am glad I can came across this hotel. Strongly recommended! I will definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Arena Htl - recommended.”
Reviews.Author: AggieOne
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated, very clean and nicely decorated rooms (choose a corner room), very good beds, friendly staff, nice lounges. Close to all the sights in Istanbul, within wallking distance of it all. If I go back to Istanbul I will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Lucked out and landed at the Arena Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TShawn
Reviews.Content: We had reserved an apartment through a travel agent. Twelve days in Istanbul meant we needed some space and a place for light meals. Upon arrival the apartment was not satisfactory. I could say more, but it would take too long. We asked for a different accommodation and the representative hooked us up with the Arena Hotel. This right sized boutique hotel, located in Sultanahment, minutes from all major attractions, was the proverbial oasis in a desert of unknown residences and hotels. It's quaint in a good way, spotless and professional. The staff (Onur, Hasan, Farouk and Selcok) catered to our every whim and advised us when ever asked. The morning breakfast is presented well, always with fresh food and enabled us to start the day knowing we had a good nutritional base. This hotel, located on a quiet street, was perfect for the two of us. It was cozy in an old world sense, with sitting and reading rooms, and an outdoor terrace (where meals are served in the "Delight" restaurant). We walk alot on vacation and it was such a joy to "come home" to our hotel and relax. Our first stay in Istanbul was much enhanced by our accommodation and the people who work there. Maybe its all of Turkey, but the staff do an amazing job of welcoming you to their city and helping you out during one's stay. My highest recommendation goes to the Arena Hotel, if you want to relax, enjoy the neighborhood and to interact with Istanbulus. Tim and Cindy O.

Reviews.Title: “Travelpro”
Reviews.Author: Trip-Review01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife and 4 other people in November, 2911. I had booked the hotel directly via the internet after doing a lot of research. This hotel was a great choice--not a typical western hotel, but a very nice family run Turkish hotel. It was in the Sultanahmet area we wanted to stay-- near all the important sites--Blue mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, etc. The hotel was fairly priced and it was well cared for, comfortable and clean. The service was quite good and the hotel staff was very helpful. The neighborhood was safe and had a lot of nice restaurants within walking distance. All in all, next time i'm in Istanbul, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quiet Excape in the Old City”
Reviews.Author: GROW756
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in this off the beaten path hotel in the center of the historical district.! We travel to Istanbul 8 to 10 times a year for the last 5 years and were delighted by the surprise we found in this quiet, comfortable well cared for hotel. We recommend it wholeheartedly and will come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great two-night stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFarrell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in November, and was pleased with the cleanliness, level of service, and most importantly the location of this hotel (central and safe). Upon arrival, my boyfriend and I were upgraded to a suite because the standard double room we'd booked was not available; the room was spacious and had a patio. Breakfast was simple and traditional, with bread, thick jams, cheese, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs and meats and olives, fresh juices - and pretty good coffee. I would book this hotel again. *It is right across from a mosque, so you will hear the call to prayer rather early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: jrmell
Reviews.Content: Good clean small hotel. Very convenient to the Old City. Helpful staff and the Breakfast where OK. ( NO dining available whilst we were there for 4 days. ) Would recommend to stay here for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Oli S
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positive: Great location (basically 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque), staff is friendly and the room/place was clean. Unfortunately I booked via Expedia, and like too often was not booking directly I had no control on choosing my room, I got a small, dark, quite grim room in the basement with a great view on the adjacent car park (and very noisy too). I haven't seen the other rooms, so it's very possible that some (or most) are fine, but just be aware that some are also pretty dire. Overall though the hotel/facilities looked a bit tired and could do with a small revamp, and I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Arena Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Keith B
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed 4 days at the Arena Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it, The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable. The only negative comment was the lighting in the room could be improved. The Breakfast was excellent with a good variety for people of all nations.The location is fantastic so near to the major attractions of Istanbul and walking distance to the Spice and Grand Bazaars. Loved it

Reviews.Title: “Small, quirky, but with great service and an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: luvs_trvl_and_dogs
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for the second time at the Arena Hotel, the first stay having been six years ago in 2005. The hotel has a lot of character and its own set of quirks and charms. This isn't a big, inpersonal chain hotel. This is a 19th Century house that has been converted into a hotel and gives you a feeling of place and time. You're not going to forget that you're in Turkey, in Sultanahmet while you're staying there. It's an experience, one with charm and unique features that are going to create memories. If you're looking for a large room with five-star comfort, you're likely better in Taksim at the Grand Hayatt or the Conrad. But if you want a stay that is going to leave you with memories of Istanbul, you're going to love the Arena. Having read some of the recent reviews, I was worried that the staff or management had changed. I found them to be the same helpful, courteous, and service-oriented people I first met five years ago. They were always willing to assist and make suggestions. I really think they go out of their way to try and make each guests' stay as enjoyable as possible. Both my friend and I had rooms up on the 4th floor, under the roof. Given the slanted nature of the roof, these were quirky, funky spaces. You had to duck to get to some parts of the room. Again, I don't see this as a disadvantage but part of the character of the place, reminding me that this was an old ottoman house and the view out across the Sea of Mamara from my rooftop window was absolutely spectacular. I understand these quirky spaces aren't for everyone and would recommend that if you're looking for something larger, book one of the Sultan's Corner rooms. Personally, I was extremely happy and would come back again in a heart beat. You're a stone's throw away from all the major historical sites - five minutes to the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque and ten to St. Sophia's.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with big service!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieK822
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay while visiting Istanbul! It's location is within walking distance to all the major sights and the tram system. This lovely boutique hotel has an adjoining restaurant that is perfect for a authentic turkish meal or to enjoy your breakfast which is included with your stay. Did I mention the staff? They are great and are very helpful with suggestions of area sights and where to eat. If I were to return Istanbul I would return to Arena Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Memories are made of great places”
Reviews.Author: Saukat
Reviews.Content: We were delayed on our internal flight from Dalaman to Istanbul so I called the hotel to inform them of our delay as they had arranged a transfer for us. It was no problem for them and sure enough our transfer waited for us outside the terminal on arrival. This was to be the lasting impression of our stay at the Arena over the next 8 days! The team of Vedat, Faruk, Hassan, Mehmet and Doghan were always obliging and ever-helpful to make our stay a most pleasing experience. Their listing at #188 of Istanbul hotels is most undeserving as they should be rated in the TOP TEN! Although the hotel had their own recommended places to eat and visit, they would even take note of any recommendations that we made to them from our own experiences. We had 2 fantastic nights dining in the Kumkapi restaurant area, part of the EminÃ¶nÃ¼ district and famous for their fish restaurants and very lively entertainment. They even arranged free shuttle transfers for us from the hotel to the restaurants. Our large room (the Sultan Corner) was worth choosing and spotlessly clean. Although we were situated right next to the mosque, the early morning call to prayer just added to the 'flavour' of the place - Incidentally, the Sokullu Mehmet mosque is a must-visit as I found the tilework even more beautiful than the bigger and more famous Blue mosque! When visiting Istanbul, the normal visitor wants to see all the famous landmarks and fit in as much as possible without the hassles of travelling between places. The Arena hotel is so well situated for this purpose, that you can take a stroll after a hearty breakfast just up the small hill and take everything in without getting lost. Speaking of breakfast, the Arena lays on a sumptuous spread every morning, and I can recommend the chef's special omlette, which could easily have fed 2 of us. I believe there is a turkish spa in the basement, unfortunately we never tried it as it was the middle of summer and we did not feel the need for this treatment. If the hotel had a swimming pool this would have given the Arena a 6-Star status! The free wi-fi was very welcome and the reception was excellent in all parts of the hotel. As I mentioned already, the hotel staff were extremely friendly and made my daughter feel really special during her stay. I wanted to smoke a cigar watching the sun set over the Marmara bay, but the hotel does not have a rooftop. However, they arranged for us to go to the hotel next door and sit on their rooftop and brought us long cooldrinks to enjoy as well. I made sure the cigar lasted long enough for us to savour every moment of this magical destination! The area is extremely safe and we would walk the narrow streets well after midnight to get back to our rooms without feeling insecure. The turkish people appreciate the tourists and accept the hordes of people with open arms and a cheery "merhaba"! We love you Arena Hotel - Ä°stanbul'u sev.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed twice and would go back again”
Reviews.Author: dandeja
Reviews.Content: The Arena Hotel is situated very near the tram, the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia in a quiet neighborhood overlooking the harbor. I stayed in two rooms on the top floor which were small but very comfortable. The triangular roof window offered a fantastic view of the harbor. The rooms were clean. These may be the two smallest rooms they have, but I was very satisfied and would stay there again. The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating. The garden bar is enchanting and the hotel very warm and friendly. A small hotel, reasonably priced with great service, in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SanamB
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great value for money. The rooms are very cute and clean. The bathrooms are clean but not too big. The location is great, very close too all the sights that one wants to see in Istanbul (5 minute walk to Hajia Sofia and Topkapi). Also, close to tram station. The staff is very nice and friendly. The managers are very nice and helpful as well. Make sure you ask them for suggestions about what to see/ where to go, etc. The breakfast was good as well. I stayed there with my mom for 3 nights and really liked the hotel so we came back for another 2 nights after a trip to south of Turkey. The first time we had a two beds room which was nice but the second time we got one of the rooms on the fourth floor which was amazing! very pretty and nice with a great view of the water. Totally recommend this hotel. Thank you so much for a great experience and an awesome stay! Will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, very enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: rustler16
Reviews.Content: Was booked into this hotel by the tour company we used while visiting Istanbul and so cannot comment on value for money. Really enjoyed the location, cleanliness, the staff was very friendly and helpful, free wifi is great. The room also had interesting character. It's walking distance to the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque and loads of other sights. It's also very close to a tram stop. Would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “It was absolutely unforgottable. Hotel was amazingly beautifu and service was super high level. Love to go there again.”
Reviews.Author: Makiaveli
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arena is best Hotel in Istanbul. Service is best, food is fresh, personel are friendly and very nice. If you decide to go to istanbul,trust me and book Hotel Arena. I plan to go there in winter, want to see how's Istanbul in winter time.

Reviews.Title: “Always welcoming”
Reviews.Author: teeyame
Reviews.Content: Located in the old section of Sultanhamet...the hotel is walking distance to the Blue Mosque+ Sophia,,,the old bathhouse. You can take the tram to any part of the city. We could always count on the concierge for expert advice and directions. My daughter and I liked the cozy atmosphere as well as the friendly chit chat with the local staff members who provided printouts of maps and tips for traveling to neighboring countries Georgia and Armenia. The decor is old Istanbul and you have a good feel of a villa. The garden serves sumptuous buffet breakfast and the hotel has free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Belen P
Reviews.Content: Arena Hotel's very convenient location plus the hospitality and kindness of the hotel's management and staff have made our 4 day stay in Istanbul unforgettable. They did all their best to make our stay comfortable and very pleasant. My daughter and I have even been upgraded to a suite room --very roomy and luxurious with a sea view. One of their staff, Dogan Kaya, even went out of his way and showed us part of the city-- brought us to the bazaars to help us get the best prices, including the Hamam and to good restaurants. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Very good value. To the management and staff, thank you so much for making this trip excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: albert20
Reviews.Content: there is a great hotel in istanbul,great service,conditions..... thank u for everything :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: AR08
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel in sultanahmet. Staff found us a room even though we were earlier than their check in time. The rooms were small, but comfortable. Very clean, and neat with robes. Watch out for some of the outlets in the old portion of the hotel which may short out if cell phones, etc are plugged in. Breakfast was standard turkish breakfast buffet with enough selection. Hassan at the front desk was wonderful, spending an hour helping set up our phone which was sending us text messages in Turkish. He also kept in touch with us when we were not even staying with them to set up a guide for our return trip to Istanbul. Tips on visiting the historic sites - a guide can bypass lines and is well worth the price if you have a small group. Do not go to the whirling dervish ceremony when jet lagged - it is a bit sleep inducing.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations - the perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: GoLongBeach
Reviews.Content: This place is a treasure in Istanbul and God's gift to the visitor ! Not enough space to list all the great features, but let me try.. 1. Friendly, gracious, kind and professional staff. Always there to help, and with a smile. 2. This is a beautiful little boutique hotel that feels like home and is quiet and elegant 3. Two things that I always hpoe for GOOD AC AND A SHOWER GOOD HOT WATER AND WATER PERSSURE......yes, the perfect room, and lovely decor 4. Incredible breakfast included. Everything from pastries to made to order omelettes 5. Great location. Quiet street but walking distance to everything. You will NOT find a better value in Istanbul. Such a pleasure to write this review. My husband is Greek and we stopped here on our way to Greece. SO glad we came!

Reviews.Title: “kind and helpful staffs”
Reviews.Author: choisooyoung
Reviews.Content: When my friend and i arrived Turkey, We were bit worried. because we didn't know much around Istanbul. Yet we got many usefull information also room was clean and nice, location was good, close to blue mosque.

Reviews.Title: “A grate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bmoghadasi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on July 7 and 19-22nd. We truly enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The hotel staffs were Professional, helpful and friendly. A 4 star hotel with 5 star services. A charming hotel with in Sultanahmet area, walking distance to all the old town sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “we love it and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteChow
Reviews.Content: We are couple from China and we stayed at arena Hotel. Our Room was very clean and location was good and they had very helpful front desk staff. It takes only 5 minutes walk to Blue Mosque and all Touristic attarctions. Better to arrange private airport pick up from the airport Through to Hotel or from hotel to Airport because cab drivers are nasty and may rip you off most of the times. They did gave us all the informations about Tours and restaurants, good tips about the city and it made our stay more pleasant. Definetely we will go back again to this Hotel in the future time and will reccomend to our friends to stay at Arena Hotel . Hoscakal Istanbul :)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is not as represented and they do not honor their cancellation policy”
Reviews.Author: fretrav650
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arena Hotel for one night and had planned to stay an additional 5 nights after our 2 week trip through Turkey. Our first night there was miserable: honking horns, people yelling and other street noise. Because of our sleepless night, we canceled the remaining 5 nights ( which we had pre-paid), giving the hotel 2 weeks notice. We were told that we would receive only half our deposit. The hotel cancellation policy is 3 days without penalty. When we reminded the hotel of their written cancellation policy, they referred us to the travel agent. After consulting the travel agent, we learned that it was the hotel who would not refund the deposit. We did receive our deposit after pressing the issue. Our friends who stayed there had to change their rooms due to street noise and we would have been wiling to try different rooms had the hotel management been helpful, instead of dismissive.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a touch of agatha christie”
Reviews.Author: amenotep
Reviews.Content: A nice small charm hotel with an atmosphere...when you step in the lobby you're stepping into a scene of an agatha christie plot...Poirot's mustache isn't far away. Could also be the set for an old '50 ies spy movie with James Mason or Humphrey bogart...It's seems that time hasn't moved in this authentically Ottoman decorated charming hotel. Nothing of the formica or plastic you 'll find in all round tourist hotels. Perfectly located at 5 to 10 minutes walking distance of the main sites. Which are all majestical (Topkapi, Aghia Sophia, Blue Mosque Grand Bazaar....where i recommend the unique Egyptian Bazaar). And close to some wonderful small Turkish restaurant's on sultanhamet. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly...and I especially commend Hassan who helped us throughout our stay. We had a nice quite large corner room, with a small terrace with a view on the marmara sea. Even though the furniture is the vintage Ottoman style. The bathroom is modern and even equipped with a jacuzzi and extremely clean. The large Ottoman bed is confortable and looks spectacular...All in all a perfect choice that will add tht special touch to the istanbul feeling.Check out their site for pictures and info, they are quite accurate.

Reviews.Title: “EVERY EFFORT WAS MADE TO MAKE OUR STAY PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshireres
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and our eight year old grandaughter stayed here for eight nights in early May on a bed and breakfast basis. We had a spotlessly clean large corner suite on the third floor with views out over the Sea of Marmaris. The excellent buffet breakfast had a wide selection of cheeses, meats and fruit, with either an omlette or boiled eggs as a hot option. The staff could not do enough to help, particularly Faruk Keles and Onor Tatli on the front desk. Onor became an instant hero by sorting out our online check-in with Turkish Airlines which required a phonecal! The hotel is located within a few minutes pleasant walk of all the major sights and only a very efficient tram ride away from the rest . We booked our stay directly with the hotel and were offered a package which included; a personal guide for a day, a boat trip on the Bosphorus which stopped off in Asia for Anatolian yoghurt!, a folk dancing concert. a dinner in the hotel and airport pick up and drop off (modern Mercedes people carrier). Every part of the package was thoroughly enjoyable and highly reccommended. The hotel is next door to one Mosque and a few yards away from another. The call to prayers early in the morning and in the evening, echoing throughout the city, only added to the magic of the stay. To make this appraisal honest I have to include one slight criticism; though the food is good, the restaurant prices are a little high, being priced in Euros and not Turkish Lira, but you don't have to eat there! We would unreservedly reccommend the Arena Hotel to any and everybody. Thanks Verdat for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly helpful, friendly staff and a superb breakfast. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: tamsynk
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Arena Hotel. Its location is ideal: within easy walking distance of Istanbul's main sites. It is comfortably elegant and provides an absolutely excellent breakfast buffet. We felt it was very good value for money. Most notable, however, was the helpfulness of the staff who went out of their way to make sure we were happy there. They are happy to give sightseeing tips and they speak several langauges, including English, French and Russian.

Reviews.Title: “The really great personalized service made this hotel outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Mominchina
Reviews.Content: My family (six of us) stayed at the Arena hotel in February. I was very pleased with the attentive service and accommodations of the hotel. Redecorating was going on and even that didnâ€™t affect our stay there. The personal service of the concierges was the fact that pleased me the most. The night we were to have our free dinner the cook was ill. The concierge walked us over to a reasonably priced restaurant that he often went to. I was totally impressed. When Omar did recover the next day, his breakfast omelets were great! They booked everything we asked for and gave us reliable information. We even wound up with small discounts on some of the tours we booked! I was touched on the last day of our visit. My husband had wanted to visit an aquarium but, of course, we had little idea of just how to get there. It so happened that one of the concierges in the front lobby had the day off and was headed in that direction. He took us in tow (all six of us) and guided us out to the aquarium. I could clearly see that without his help we could have been wandering around for hours trying to figure out their tram system. One of the very good things about this hotel is that you are within walking distance of all the major sites â€“ Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Sophia Hagia, etc. Walking about one fourth of a city block you then turn to go up the hill. Then, it is a short walk and then you turn right or left depending on your goal. I highly recommend the Arena. Its personal service is outstanding. Itâ€™s good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location-perfect service”
Reviews.Author: annamarbz
Reviews.Content: I staid in Arena hotel for 5 days in February 2011 with my sister. The location is excellent. 2 minutes on foot to the Blue Mosque and Haya Sofia. The neighbourhood is safe and quiet and we never felt insecure although we were 2 girl. The service was EXCELLENT. As a hotel employee myself i can reassure that the service is perfect. A small issue with the internet access was solved almost immediately and the front office staff treated us like family. The food is also amazing. Breakfast is ok for an eastern country and dinner was superb...!!!One of the best meals we have ever had. Just keep in mind that there is a mosque nearby that makes some noise in the morning but it depends on each ones' mood if it will find it bothering or interesting.For me it was an add to the general atmosphere!!!I would like to thank the Arena Team for everything they have done for us. We will be surely back..!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the most perfect hotels I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: williegee
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to find the superlatives needed to describer the Arena Hotel. Hotel is actually something of a misnomer as a name for this wonderful place since the feel of it is more that of the private home that it once was. One feels that one is being welcomed by the most hospitable family to enjoy their house. The staff here make the experience what it is--their helpfulness, their friendliness, their knowledgeability. They are all well versed in the ways of Istanbul and its transportation, they answer every question about how to get to some place with detailed information and often with helpful computer print outs of maps. The highest level of service is available from this personnel 24/7 as my wife and I found when we were leaving for the airport at 5 AM and were taken care of with a full breakfast as though we had been coming down to the lobby at more regular hours. Which brings me to the subject of the breakfast and of the restaurant in general. The breakfast buffet is one of the most beautiful I have ever seen and partaken of--it is lavish in the choices which it offers. It is the work of Murat Ozdemir and his wonderful assistants, but it is only the beginning of what they offer. The restaurant is available 24/7--this is no idle claim--we tested it at various odd hours when we wanted food and got the same kind of elegant meals no matter what the time of day or night was. Fantastic cuisine, great cooking, but the availability of it at any time of day or night increased the feeling that we had somehow been invited into someone's house and given access to the family cook. Great food imaginatively prepared and superb Turkish wines the existence of which I had not even suspected. We were during our stay here upgraded to a beautiful corner room with a view of the Sea of Marmara. We used to come home early from our rounds of touring just to be in place for the sunsets which we could view from our room--nothing in Istanbul surpassed them. This hotel is one of the gems of world hospitality. It is perfection and I would recommend it heartily to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: HabeebS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for a week. The staff were really nice and very helpful. The Hotel is ten minnutes walkig distance from Blue Masjid and Tram line. We liked the Mediterranean breakfast served at the hotel. It was a wonderful experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “small hotel with 4 great hotel managers”
Reviews.Author: LiveToLeave
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 10 minute walk to the metro, up a steep hill that's cobble-stoned. It is located in the old section, on a narrow side street. Price is right (I negotiated down and they accepted my offer) but rooms are teeny tiny and shower stall is almost claustrophobic. That said, the 4 hotel managers were so nice and helpful. They waited for us to make sure we got back safely each night. They gave us restaurant tips and new year's eve recommendations. If you spend a lot of time in the room, don't stay here but if you want a caring hotel experience, Arena Hotel is a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jack28_10
Reviews.Content: There is a beautiful place and hotel.Everything was great especially about the Arena Hotel.I thing i will come back soon again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly staff. Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Carlijn_bel
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 week in the Arena Hotel in Istanbul. It was a very pleasant stay. Beautiful and spacious hotel rooms and very clean. The staff was very helpful and friendly.The hotel has an excellent location. On a next visit i will definitly choose again the Arena Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely small hotel in walking distance of many tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: tridonald
Reviews.Content: The Arena Hotel is located in the heart of Istanbul's "old quarter." You can walk to many of the most famous sites including the Grand Bazaar. The hotel is small yet comfortable. The rooms were also small but very nicely done. The breakfast was a highlight.

Reviews.Title: “stolen money , abusive staff , loud plumbing ????”
Reviews.Author: Rashid786
Reviews.Content: I would like to expand and give a detailed account of the incident reported below by my partner , I would have not wasted any more time with a company such as â€œarea hotel â€œ if not for their blatant lies and counter accusations against us.. As detailed by my partner (English being her 3rd language) we did experience being robbed while staying at this so called hotel. My chronological account of the events is as follows: The safe provided in each room are a Turkish made safe constructed by : Truva ,-- , -- The safe I self requires the user to use a 4 digit pin number , I used the same 4 digit number I use for all 3 of my credit cards , I phone and the same number I use for my telephone banking. On returning back to the hotel one evening I realised the safe no longer accepted my 4 digit number, attempting 3 times I engaged the time delay which ment I had to wait 15 mins to try again, again I tried with no success, my immediate suspicion was that someone had accessed our room safe. I called one of the staff who came in all smiling and said â€œ donâ€™t worry this happens all the time, the safe forgot your number â€œ he used his master code to unlock our safe after which I did confront him and asked â€œ how could a computer chip forget my 4 digit numberâ€� he could not give no answer. I was not impressed the least hence why I immediately took the details of the safe and used Google to get the manufactures details as I refused to believe that a computer could so easily forget our pin number. It was not until the following morning that we realised that 500 Euros were missing ( be it from the dressing table ) upset and angry my partner confronted the receptionist , his response was â€œ I am not bothered â€œ and then obscene language was used by him while other guests were watching , (Photos of this staff member were taken by me at this point) He finally after 20 mins agreed to call his manger (as he refused to call the police) the manger spoke to my partner and to myself and assured me that each safe would remember how many times the master code was used to access it, This was Sunday morning and as a result no technician could be called out until the next working day (Monday). Monday the tall manger ( who is the only one who can really speak English or who possess any kind of people skills ) assured us the technician would come and when he did he would call us , no technician turned up and our check out was the following day. Tuesday the manger did not turn up and neither did the mystery safe technician. Upon my check out I asked for the bill and the reply was â€œyour bill has already been paid â€œI was shocked as I knew my credit cards had not been taken out of my wallet in more than 5 days (I have since learnt they used my Lloyds tsb visa card without my permission, and a fraud report had been filled with my bank I am still to this day at a total loss of who they could have got my card details) I was even made to pay the 30 Euros transfer fee to the airport. We did approach the police the very next day after the robbery, the police station was just 500meters at the bottom of the road only being able to communication with them by speaking Arabic we learnt that any report could only be made with the help of a Turkish translator, we spoke to two officers one being a very tall gentleman called Ahmed. We showed them our passports and were advised that they may come and visit the hotel (as far as I am aware nothing came of it) 500 Euros was not worth wasting a full day or more chasing a police report, acquiring a translator etc. Mr DEREAÄžZI accuses us of make a false claim from our insurance company BUT at the same time also says we refused to make a police report, The manager also added the abusive staff memeber no longer works within the company, ( Mr DEREAÄžZI AS YOU MAY OR MAY NOT KNOW ANY SORT OF INSURANCE CLAIM MADE WOULD HAVE TO BE SUPPORTED BY A POLICE CRIME REFFERENCE NUMBER , YOU CAN NOT ACCUSE US OF MAKING A FALSE INSURANCE CLAIM AND THEN AT THE SAME TIME SAY WE REFUSED POLICE HELP IT MAKES ZERO SENSE. Any way I dont want to spend too long dwelling on how some little petty thief stole some money , but one thing which I did notice this hotel does to many customers is that one first arriving you are given the BASEMENT room which has two single beds and very very loud pipes , IF THIS ROOM IS GIVEN TOO U SAY NO WAY! OR BETTER STILL LOOK ELSE WERE! I have tried to be as factual as I can in this review and have kept any venom I had for this place locked away as life is too short to dwell on thief. God bless xx

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel , Rude staff ever !! avoid avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilham01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in This horrible hÃ´tel for 5 night, my husband saw it on trip advisor and we agree to book it , so We did via booking.com , the first day we arrived there , we got a room with two single beds , itâ€™s was totally differents about what we booked , a very small room , we talked with reception man and we showed him our booking for a double room , he said weâ€™re full and he promissed to give us a double room next day , Well we get a small room again but i twas with 1 bed better than the first one ,,â€¦ The next day we were going ouside at night and we decide do not take a lots money with us , maybe i twill not be safe in Istanbul at night , so i left 500 Euros in my wallet and were sure of this â€¦.both of us We went out at 01h00 and we get back at 05h00 morning, when we reached our room my husband tryed to open the save wich is in our room but the save was refusing our passeword Wich we knows by hearth and wich we used to open the save several time ,, then my husband went and calll the reception man ,, this lattter was soooo cool and said yes it happents always and he typed his passeword then ours save was opening , we were really surprising how a machine can forget the passeword !!! he said no itâ€™s normal and he was acting sooo normal Keepin saying its happen in the hotel always !! The worst thing that next day morning i cheked my wallet to got some money and i found that 500 euros are missing i was feeling so bad and we went to the reception asked about the manager , they said we can help what s your prb ??? My husband told the man on reception that some one stoll our money and we need to talk with the manager, i was sooo nervouse my husband tryed to explaine to him that im feelin bad now coz of this , then he answer : i dont care !!!!! and he started to insult us very very bad words and 3 britich ladies were there at same time and they listen to every thing â€¦after that the manager caame and say sorry but we have to make sure if some one really tryed to open your save and took money , and he said that the staff who insult us is now not working wwith us no more coz he was honest and said to me that he insult you !! But the manager couldnt do nothg for us we paid the hotel , trensfer , and even he didnt do nothg for us , he said some people will come for the save but he was just telling us that coz he knows that we should go next day â€¦i gave them my email â€¦we didnt get nothg from them I twas my horrible vacation ever Please folks dont stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: blackpool47
Reviews.Content: I have friends who's idea of luxury is to stay in a five star hotel. Not mine. I'm looking for somewhere to stay with minimum hassle, reasonable prices etc. Here I found one of the few hotels which I actually wanted to visit again. It's a boutique hotel without the hundreds of staff who might be available in a five star establishment. Staff are TURKISH not English native speakers so occasionally mistakes happen. Should anyone be surprised? Here I found that when something specific went wrong it was immediately rectified. When our prebooked air transport taxi didnt arrive staff joined us in hunting down a passing taxi. 'This is an "expensive" hotel in istanbul by my stated standards as above but I do not begrudge it. Location and service is superb and when problems arise they will be solved quickly. Rooms I've stayed in are excellent, This hotel hasd exceeded many five star hotels I've stayed in worldwide, I'll be back next time i'm in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful - worst night of our five weeks in Europe”
Reviews.Author: MJS1948
Reviews.Content: Most unpleaseant experience - no welcome or greeting of any kind. After producing our on-line confirmation, and waiting while two male staff talked incessantly among themselves and ignored us, we were eventually advised the Corner Suite we had booked months earlier was not available. A very pleasant young woman offered a room in an appartment property up the hill which we accepted simply because we were exhausted by heat and travel. There was no phone, no mini-bar, no access to hotel services. Ghastly, third-rate, "home handyman" type finish to the bathroom. Power point and towel rails fell off the wall when we used them, and the hand basin detached from the wall. No sink plug in hand basin. Kitset-type furniture in bedroom, which was bright and quite spacious. Offered late check-out and free dinner as compensation, but dreadful food, with cats jumping on to the dining table when one of us left the restaurant for a short time. Disappointing experience for the last night of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “excellent istanbul boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bstephany
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance of sultanahmet attractions, yet on a quiet side street, great for sleeping. Staff is very friendly, helpful, and speak excellent English. Breakfasts are a real treat as is their restaurant "Delight" with patio seating. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, avoid, avoid”
Reviews.Author: lovingmyholidays
Reviews.Content: Before I start, please note I stayed at this hotel a year ago, so may be things have improved. My advice would be to ignore the good reviews on this site, but let me start with the positives. There is just one really: location is brilliant (5 mins from Blue Mosqua and Ayia Sofia) though the penalty for staying in this part of Istanbul is being woken by the call for prayer, although I personally think this adds to the atmosphere. The street the hotel is on is, however, rather down at heel. As for the rest: do not even consider a standard room, they are like cells: just wide enough for two 3ft single beds shoved aagainst each wall and one bedside table between. Our room was under the eaves and very hot. The air conditioning was broken for half our stay (to be fair staff did provide fans on request). When it worked, it was not sufficient to cool the room in May so would be woefully inadequate in summer. The sulatn corner rooms are quite spacious and the only ones you should consider at all. The shower was good,except when the hot water ran out, but the ceiling was peeling. The rooms are not 100% clean, the bed linen is horrid and has nylon frills on it and the pillows are polyester bricks. Also there is an odd habit of leaving dusty plastic flowers on the bed. The minibar was fridge in the corner of the room which had to be switched off as it made the room even hotter. There was no curtain on the window so if the Muezzin didn't wake you the sun did. Breakfast is quite extensive and there is some nice food, but the hot food was never above tepid. Whilst I wouldn't personally choose the dead granny style of decoration the hotel has adopted, from the website it looked very nicely maintained and that's why we chose it. In reality it's just a rather depressing gloomy place that needs a serious makeover. I'd be amazed if you couldn't find better for your money. Everything else about Istanbul iks beyond fantastic so this was the only low point.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well located”
Reviews.Author: kasey1945
Reviews.Content: Arena is situated in a nondescript location a five minute walk from the Blue Mosque. There is nothing noticable at all on the outside, but inside is a different story. The staff was polite, friendly and accommodating. The room well made up and completely furnished. Very nice breakfast. Try room 107 if on a honeymoon. Only down side was the morning call to prayer at a nearby Mosque, but that is to be expected in a Muslim country.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Taswell43
Reviews.Content: Our room was extremely small and the bathroom could not have been any smaller. The bathroom had old fittings with mould around the bottom of the shower and was quite unpleasant to use. The bedroom had just enough room to walk around the bed and no more. The man who helped us with our luggage continually held his hand out for a tip and actually would not go until we gave him one. Having said that the bar area and food was good. The view from our hotel room was also very beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Warmly welcomed and treated like family.”
Reviews.Author: nmontheroad
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about the Arena Hotel. We were met at the airport and treated like family from the moment we walked in the door. The staff were relaxed, friendly and anxious to make our stay in Istanbul memorable and pleasurable. Everyone spoke English well and were able to answer any questions we had. The room was spacious (Sultan Corner Suite) and well appointed. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was stocked with everything we needed. We made daily use of the tea making service. Breakfast was attractively presented and consisted of a wide variety of freshly prepared foods. The location is great for all of Sultanahmet's attractions. We were able to easily walk everywhere. Because the hotel is located off any of the main streets there was no road noise or loud passersby. The call to prayer from the adjacent mosque was loud, but we actually felt that it enhanced the feeling that we were in such an exotic place and we did not feel that it was problematic. In short, we would not hesitate to stay here again or to recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the Luxury Due a Sultan at the Arena Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joshncnow
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the reception at the Arena, you know you have come home to good friends. You are welcomed by the staff with tea or coffee, homemade cookies, and Turkish Delight while your check in details are handled for you. Your room is gorgeous: hardwood floors with the patina of ages, covered with Turkish carpets; windows with a view of the Bosphorus, a minaret in the foreground; plush towels and robes, the spa and Turkish bath on the premises; a feast at breakfast as well as exceptional lunches and suppers. You will return again and again, as we have, to this wonderful hotel within a short five minute walk to Sultanahmet, the Blue Mosque, and St. Sophia. Also, the hotel is within walking distance to the Cistern of 1001 Columns, Topkapi, the Grand Bazaar, and the Spice Bazaar -- perfect location. Enjoy the personal attention you receive at this beautiful 19th century home that is your hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, clean and comfortable with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: patNEScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days and found the hotel very much to our liking. As it was a special birthday/wedding anniversary the Hotel provided champagne and beautiful bouquet of roses in the room (by request). Room comfortable with view of Marmara Sea. Ate in hotel 2 nights in the Delight Restaurant - lovely staff and food above average. Wine very expensive even though grapes are grown in Turkey. Raki (Ouso style spirit) was very acceptable. Location is 5 minute uphill walk to Blue Mosque and Hagai Sophia. Situated in a small side street .

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and locatÄ±on, but dÄ±sappoÄ±nted after vÄ±ewÄ±ng websÄ±te”
Reviews.Author: backoaptravellers
Reviews.Content: Wonderful warm and helpful welcome, brÄ±llÄ±ant to have pÄ±ck up from aÄ±rport. Was expectÄ±ng an experÄ±ence as depÄ±cted on theÄ±r websÄ±te wÄ±th fresh flowers Ä±n the bedroom etc to fÄ±nd dusty, tÄ±red sÄ±lk flowers and a shower Ä±n need of renovatÄ±on. Had a Sultan corner room and had accepted the web sÄ±te package of aÄ±rport pÄ±ck up (brÄ±llÄ±ant), tour guÄ±de (not needed), complÄ±mentary dÄ±nner (Ä±t was a specÄ±al cheap set menu) and turkÄ±sh bath and massage (agaÄ±n dÄ±d not match the web sÄ±te, no lÄ±t candles, soft musÄ±c, very perfunctory and short). So keep the expectatÄ±ons as normal and don't go for the package and Ä±t wÄ±ll be fÄ±ne. Very clean, good breakfast, Ä±ndÄ±vÄ±dual decor and fantastÄ±c staff.

Reviews.Title: “Arena Hotel will definitely enhance your Istanbul esperience.”
Reviews.Author: alfreddo
Reviews.Content: We were blown away by the beautiful ottoman-style Sultan's Corner bedroom and hotel lobby, but even more by the friendly and very helpful staff. This hotel is a jewel, very close to the attractions of Sultanahmet. Can recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location....nice and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jtnwdc
Reviews.Content: Great location (in Sultanahmet area), good food, rates are fair, staff was welcoming and friendly. Would definitely return; highly recommend to fellow travelers searching for a nice hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more...”
Reviews.Author: Ilvespista
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul in march 2009... We've found the arena hotel on booking.com. On the website the hotel seems very clean and confortable, but it's not really like that. In our room the window's glass was cracked and the room wasn't so clean. Heating was not sufficient, so they gave us an electric heater. It must be added that our postcards never arrived although the staff had offered to post them. The location is very central, this is the best quality of the hotel. Eventually we did not feel at ease...

Reviews.Title: “Not great but nice place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Rovshana
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at Arena hotel in August. Thereâ€™s not much to say about service or breakfast (we left early and couldnâ€™t even try it). However I decided to leave few comments about the hotel. Good location, quiet street. We took a taxi from the airport, it was not that difficult to find the hotel â€“ they have signs with hotel name and arrows pointing you in the right direction in almost every tiny street. You just follow the signs. Old fashioned but clean hotel. Friendly staff. Room size was a quite surprise for us - big enough for standard double room. A/C working. Two things were disappointing â€“ broken window in a bathroom (it was simply broken and laying there) and the BED (!). Instead of one double bed they had two twin beds pushed together (!). Iâ€™ve heard that it can be found in many hotels in Europe but it was very inconvenient. Just imagine â€“ a huge gap between the beds/mattresses in a middle of the night. If I had to stay longer I would demand to get a room with a real king bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Crazy4jamaica
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a very friendly helpful staff. The hotel is an old mansion converted to a hotel. It has a quaint courtyard for breakfast and drinks. We were upgraded to one of the Sultan corner rooms. It is roomey and comfortable. The shower worked well but could be upgraded. It is convenient to tourist sites near the Blue Mosque. You come and go through narrow cobblestoned streets. This can be confusing at first but easily overcome unless you can't do hills. Taxis and transfers can be arranged through the hotel staff. Not a five star or luxurious hotel but a great place to use as a base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: aefrkf
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The staff (manager) was extremely helpful. The hotel is on a quiet street, but within easy walking distance of the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. We also walked to the Grand Bazaar and numerous other places. The rooms are charming. The breakfast buffet was excellent. We also had a good dinner in the hotel dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff. A gem from the past”
Reviews.Author: Womanwithaltitude
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located; just a short walk to Sultanahmet Square and all its attractions. (Donâ€™t miss the Cisterna.) It is quiet and old-fashioned in a very pleasant kind of way and feels like a set from Murder on the Orient Express. The staff are very helpful and friendly, right from the welcome drink and plate of biscuits on arrival. Breakfast is extensive in its selection. We only discovered the Turkish Bath as we checked out which was a shame. If you are looking for an alternative to the generic hotel experience, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “BEST EVER”
Reviews.Author: tresantoj
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Istanbul.Very friendly stuff,wonderful rooms everythin and everything was so nice in this hotel.This is my favourite hotel after this holiday.I will stay there at all my visits to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant place”
Reviews.Author: milena73
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at arena for a week.It was a dream from beginning to the end.When we check in the hotel we were very tired and the stuff do every paperwork very fast for us.After first night rest we see they offer us a free dinner for staying 3 or more days (we were stayin 5)It was a very kind suprise for us.Later on they arrange everything we need in Istanbul taxi,guide,shopping,food etc.I have stayed lots of hotels around the world and most of them were 5 stars but non of them were kind and helpful as this hotels stuff.Emre,Mustafa and Ercan did their best for as at the front desk.Their delight restaurant was really a great one which you can eat fish and good wine.The room which we stayed in was a standart one but it was really more than the money we paid.At all it was our first visit to Turkey and to Istanbul but as this was my best holiday all my life.We strongly recommend very very much to this hotel to our friends.And l cant wait to go back at novemberâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel. The staff was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: TDHArizona
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Arena Hotel which is a special class hotel. It is located down a quiet street away from any major sites but yet, within walking distance of most places you want to visit. The only drawback is that taxi's had a difficult time finding Arena. I would just have the driver drop me off at one of the nearby tourist sites and walk the downhill 5-10 minute walk. I always felt safe in the area as I was a solo female traveler. My room was beautiful and quite large. The staff is the highlight of Arena Hotel. They went beyond any expectations to assure that I had a great visit to Turkey. They would take great care to book restaurants for me that I would feel comfortable as a solo tourist. The staff even put together an excursion to Antalya for me at the last minute. They purchased concerts tickets for me to two different concerts prior to my arrival. They were always pleasant and accommodating to me. The restaurant that is attached was a fun place to hang out in the morning at breakfast and chat with the other guests. At night, a great place to finish off the day with a glass of wine. I recommend taking an adapter if traveling from USA. The staff allowed guests to use wireless laptop to check emails. Very nice to not have to bring my computer with me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice in the right location”
Reviews.Author: marcogiov
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in Arena. Yes it's true that taxi drivers may ask the locals to get there, but then it's a two minute walk to the Hippodrome and the Blue Mosque and you can pleasantly stroll to Hagia Sophia and Topkapi, without mingling with Istanbul traffic chaos . Arena (standard) room was elegant, but not cramped. Nice breakfast, with an enticing choice of cheese and pastries. We also dined at the romantic restaurant, more expensive than the soulless others in the neighborhood, but still cheap in absolute terms. Wi-fi connectivity was spotty. I would surely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Istanbul in Arena Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janini2009
Reviews.Content: Arena Hotel is a Turkish traditional hotel well located next to all important sights in the old town. We chose a package offering including airport transfer to the hotel, a dinner in the hotel's own restaurant, a whole day guided tour and turkish bath. Mustafa and his team where always very friendly, breakfast and dinner with a good selection of local food and the rooms clean and with some great views on a near by mosque and the bay. We can highly recommend this hotel. Service-Price ratio is very good and the service excellent. Ask for BÃ¼lent Aslan as a guide if you are looking for an English speaking guide. We were very happy with him. PS. Free Wifi in the hotel available.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the old city”
Reviews.Author: Mundii
Reviews.Content: Arena hotel is a well located hotel in the old city. Rooms are clean and well furnished with international TV and Tea and coffee facilities. The bathroom was fairly basic but everything worked. We booked through the website and although the price was good, we were initally disappointed that the room we were given was on the small side. However on request we were moved to a good size room on the third floor at no extra cost. The room on the corner of the hotel had excellent views of the neighbouring mosque and other parts of the old city. Prayers from the mosque will be a feature of your stay though - at 5am every day - unless you are a very deep sleeper. The hotel itself is very pleasant with penty of antique/vintage furnishings. The best thing about the hotel though was the helpful staff, who were always available to assist with any request. Turning up a little late for breakfast never proved a problem. Breakfast itself was pretty good - fairly typical for Istanbul with plenty of cheeses to choose from. One problem you will likely encounter if you stay at this hotel is that taxis cannot find it. The hotel can provide you with a good map/guide once you get there but even this is not enough for the average taxi driver. During our four-day stay, not once could a taxi driver find the hotel without stopping several times to ask. Print a detailed map beforehand if you can. Overall, especially given the package we got (as it was off season) we were pleased with our choice. The one-way airport transfer was as described, good quality and on-time, the Turkish bath was free as promised and the valentines package was a nice touch. Safety-wise, fire exits are well signed and smoke alarms are in place. If you want to stay in the old city, this is a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Dostlar
Reviews.Content: I stayed alone in Arena Hotel for business for couple days. I was searching a hotel near oldcity and also seaport, i happended to this hotel on the web. Everything was perfect service, staff and rooms but breakfast was ending at 10 oclock it was very early for me. The most thing i like in Arena was the room facing to sea. I will stay here again next time

Reviews.Title: “Cozy like home”
Reviews.Author: patricia00351
Reviews.Content: The owner of Arena Hotel grew up in the house and converted it to a hotel, using much of the original furniture and ambience. It's a quiet location in old Istanbul within walking distance to Istanbul's most famous attractions. Breakfast is served as part of your stay and the dining room is open for lunch and dinner. Staff will often serve tea and cookies when they see you in the sitting room, either using the computer or reading the many guidebooks available to hotel guests. The rooms are clean and inviting and a turkish bath is available on-site.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the decor”
Reviews.Author: HughAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Arena in the "old "town. The position was excellent, close to all the action etc. The rooms were well appointed with 5 star fittings and furnishings. We particularly liked the dining room appointments, with their settings, like being at a wedding reception at a posh hotel. The staff were the best I have encounted in my travels and I have travelled a lot.. We took advantage of their Turkish baths and Masseur at a reasonable price. I would certainly recomend this hotel for service, position, food, atmosphere and value. Phil Duthoit Australia .

Reviews.Title: “Arena in Oldcity”
Reviews.Author: travconme
Reviews.Content: If you want the best hotel in Istanbul, stay at the Arena in Oldcity, Istanbul. Great location, antique style, brand new, imaculately clean facilitÄ±es, excellent accommodation and very helpful and courteous staff. We stayed only 4 nights and we can say the friendly staff patiently took the time to help resolve lost property issues, gave us directÄ±ons to destinatÄ±ons we wished to visit and listened to personal problems not related to the hotel. Concierge and cleaners were also very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Arena Hotel â€“ a real Turkish delight!”
Reviews.Author: patsibmon
Reviews.Content: What a warm welcome â€“ after arriving at the hotel at about 4am (thanks to Easy Jet!) we were awaited by a very friendly receptionist and waiter who offered us tea and cookies. The bedroom for the three of us was clean and neat with a view of the nearby mosque. The hotel is boutique-style with a great historic atmosphere. The breakfast buffet is rich and tasty. All the attractions of Sultanahmet are within walking distance, which we found very convenient. The area is quiet and we felt very comfortable from the first moment on. A big plus is the friendly staff, which was always ready to help us with recommendations, bookings or giving directions. We can recommend Arena Hotel to everybody; itâ€™s a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Need to read the fine print”
Reviews.Author: CDBinSC
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Arena Hotel and while the hotel was adequate, and the staff was pleasant, pay attention to the details. For example, a posting on Trip Advisor noted that if a stay was longer three days, there was free airport transport. We stayed five and was never offered such a service. Also there is a discount if you pay the hotel bill in cash, but that is listed nowhere on their website. When we asked about that because our friends were given that benefit, we were told it was because we did not book with their webiste, which we did. We were also told to book our taxis through the hotel, but the taxi they booked for us charged twice the amount for the same trip we took by using a tax from the street. A free Internet connection is offered by the hotel, but only if you are in the lobby does it work. My husband informed the staff of this, but no action was taken. The rooms were smaller than depicted on the website and could have been cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NeilAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Arena is in a great part of the city for the main tourist sites.. However it is so close to the Blue Mosque that you'll be woken to the 5.30am chants from the speakers mounted on the minarets. Our airport pickup, arranged by the hotel didn't show up and at 45 lira was a bit steep, we got the return trip for picked up at the hotel 14 lira. The corner room we had was very nice and a good size. Breakfast is well worth waking up for, a big selection to suit all tastes (all from a cold buffet). The hotel is very safe and the staff are very freindly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ad6ab
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel right in the heart of Sultanhamet with attentive and friendly staff. Can't beat the location and the rooms were small and pleasant and clean. The 5 Am wake up call each morning (and it's LOUD) from the Blue Mosque, about 100 meters away was quaint but I am glad it was not habit forming. Highest recommendation for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, loved Staff!”
Reviews.Author: marshaller
Reviews.Content: well actually it was last week when I had chance to stay in that lovely and charming hotel. it was our last holiday in 2008 with my wife and we had already heard so many things about turkey but we did not know neither except that we could find a really good hotel, afterwards we saw that hotel via internet which was seemed so cute and acceptable place to spend our holiday.well first of all I am gonna go through the front desk clerks they welcomed us with all turkish hospitality and warmly that was our firstimpressed and reason why we enjoyed our hotel.if I have to give name actually all of them were very nice and gentle as I remember one of them Mr. Tariq I hope I have written his name properly otherwise all due respect. He was very helpfull and kind to us as rest of other receptionist and the staff in the hotel but the gem is here Tariq. He is their concierge servise. He spent so much time with us and gave us great advise on how to plan our day. He made reservations for us for dinner, and gave us directions to everything and also obtained taxis for us when we needed them. He is so very helpful, He is what made our stay there perfect. ok lets go to rooms I mean their charming,well designed in other word tastefully,large and the most important thing for all of us itÂ´scleanliness can not be discussed and other thing during our stay I never heard any noise neither inside the hotel nor outside the hotel so probably they have sound proof rooms or well blocked, honestly I was gonna ask it but obviously I forget it . the restaurant it is perfect actually I have no words in my dictionary to describe it is excellence,every kind of dishes can be found especially turkish meal is delicious. seriously there are so many things I wanna talk about this hotel but as you see this message gonna be endless if I keep writting like this so before I finish my review I am sure you wonder know what about their position it is situated centre of the istanbul just a few steps out from the hotel you will have found yourself centre of wonderfull city with ancient and modern life will be waiting for you just around where you stay . I do not thing so I need to talk about the name of the historical places which are situated around the hotel you will be visiting during your stay, I can just say that because of it is incredibly good situation you will not waste your time those are all near each other just walk a little up or down you will find them . finally IÂ´Dlike to say that I am not gonna get any commissione from that hotel because of my all compliments about it , actually it is my duty and I am really glad to make its advertisement because it is worth staying and I am sure with all my sincerity that you will like it and will be fascinated with all beauty of things around you and where you stay obviously it is gonna be your hotel and other hand your second home to stay during your holiday in ISTANBUL ..AT THE ARENA HOTEL...all my best regards whoever reads my review ....

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing service, cramped quarters”
Reviews.Author: chebella
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon in early June and our travel agent arranged for us to stay at the Arena Hotel, under the description that it was a 4* superior hotel. The location is convenient and it is on a quieter street in the Sultanahmet and, upon check-in, the staff was very welcoming and we were able to converse in English easily. However, that's where the good points ended for us. The room was tiny and was not as well appointed as a 4* hotel room should have been. Unfortunately, the air conditioning was broken when we checked in and there were no screens on the windows. The only thing the hotel staff said they could do at the time was to give us a fan, there was no discussion of changing rooms or switching us to another hotel. We found out that the hotel had been lying to other guests who's air condition wasn't working either that week, continuing to tell them that it would be fixed soon. Luckily our travel agency was able to accommodate us at another hotel. However, the staff at the Arena hotel blatantly lied to our travel agency in discussions regarding our situation and told them that the air conditioning was working just fine and that they had delivered a special honeymoon present to us from the travel agency (which they hadn't given us). The travel agency also sent a time-sensitive fax to the hotel for us, which the hotel handed to us too late. I wish the Arena hotel had lived up to it's description and (assuming) previous experiences of the travel agency. We were expecting a wonderful stay and instead got a frustrating, disappointing experience. Would not recommend this hotel for more than it's convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “The wonderful end of a dream trip”
Reviews.Author: CatMamma
Reviews.Content: WeÂ´ve been traveling through Greece and Turkey for almost a month and our last stop was Istanbul. This hotel was perfect from the arrival to the end : the best location to Istanbul sightseeings, a warm reception with tea and cookies, a lovely small room in the basement, very cozy and quiet - a pity it had no view, but it was so good, one would hardly miss it, a wonderful restaurant with the best food. The breakfast is an attraction per se, you should see the size of the buffet and the variety of things offered. Three days werenÂ´t enough to try one of each ! The staff couldnÂ´t be more friendly, they offered us a nice relaxing tea when we arrived from a "busy day in town" - Istanbul has so much to see ! If youÂ´re looking for a home with all possible advantages, I recommend this hotel. IÂ´m surely staying there again when I return to Turkey. DonÂ´t miss it !

Reviews.Title: “Warm hospitality at the Arena Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessinSeattle3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary with a trip to Turkey and while in Istanbul stayed at the Arena Hotel. The front desk staff welcomed us with a sit-down tea and cookies and surprised us the first night at dinner with a special cake with sparklers! The entire staff was extremely helpful directing us to various sites and booking airport transfers. The "Sultan's Room" was just like in the picture, very clean and spacious. The bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Arena Hotel, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ailie_h_miles
Reviews.Content: We booked into the tastefully decorated and impeccably clean Sultan's Corner suite. It was lovely and bright, with lots of windows, a flat-screen TV hooked up to sattelite channels and even a small balcony looking out over the sea... A perfect escape when Istanbul all gets a bit too much! We had a very pleasing stay. Unlike many other reviewers, my earplugs remain unused as I didn't find the call to prayer disturbing at all. On only one occasion did I fail to sleep soundly and in that instance, I'd actually been woken by a dream rather than any noise! The hotel was perfect for our needs, our room was made more relaxing with the addition of complimentary slippers and bathrobes and the location is wonderful, just a stone's throw from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Byzantine cistern, Grand Bazaar and a multitude of other fabulous historic sites. The Arenaâ€™s breakfast buffet is fairly standard and did not differ in content from day to day. It was lacking fresh fruit, but there was plenty of bread, yogurt, cereals, preserves, and er, small biscuits, to choose from! Slightly baffling, but I ate them anyway, justifying this with the sound reasoning that itâ€™s clearly traditional and a Turkish breakfast staple. (My tongue is firmly in cheek) If you are planning to stay here I offer the following advice: If you *can* book a transfer from the airport, do so! The Sultanahmet streets are badly signposted and ALL of the cab drivers we encountered were unable to find the Arena Hotel, even with a map. The transfer companies on the other hand, know exactly where they're going. From Sabiha, it's worth shopping around. Backpackerstravel.net were offering 20 Euros PP each way when I booked - cheaper than anywhere else. Would I recommend it? Oh, yes, definitely. The service was good and in particular, Engin on the front desk is good fun and very helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Arena Hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: mrstoot
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Arena Hotel for four days and enjoyed the ambiance, the staff and the restaurant. Our room was tastefully decorated, and very comfortable, although there was not too much closet space. We had a lot of fun with the night manager, Engin, who was a great sport. The Delight Restaurant was a gem, with delicious, fresh food served in a lovely outdoor garden. The Arena Hotel is a lovely small, charming hotel in the Old City district of Sultanahmet, close to many of the city's famous sites. We would highly recommend it to anyone who does not want to stay in the impersonal large hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travebug
Reviews.Content: The Arena Hotel has lovely staff, who are happy to organise anything you need.....they met our group of 6 friends at the airport, and organised guides for sightseeing at very good prices. The Arena has several categories of rooms - splash out and go for the Sultans corner. We had a King size 4 poster bed, a flatscreen TV, views from 3 sides of the room, and heaps of room.....much more than I expected for a boutique property. The breakfasts were enjoyable, and part of our room rate, but for dinner take a quick walk out to the restaurant and cafe areas where the variety is fantastic. The restaurant has a coutyard filled with flowers and shade trees, so it was a lovely place to dine. The wine list is limited, but we still found some ok bottles to have with a meal! Great location - walking distance to the blue mosque, grand bazarr etc.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in restored mansion.”
Reviews.Author: Tzipi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arena in 2006 and this Spring 2007. The hotel is a restored mansion with, for example, the previous occupant's beautiful Turkish ceramics on bedroom walls. We have stayed in three different rooms, all comfortable, clean, charmingly decorated and including nicely tiled, modern bathrooms. Guests are greeted with a drink and pastry by friendly staff. We noticed three improvements over 2006. Breakfast is much better, taxi drivers now know where the Arena is, and the area looks less run-down as more buildings are renovated. I feel safe to walk at night. The only real noise I noticed was the daily dawn call to prayers. Having traveled enough in Muslim areas I have no problem sleeping through the call to prayers, but I admit the first time can be a shock. Calls are taped and played over loud speakers; several can be heard each beginning at a slightly different time and in a different key. Result: cacophony. (So why come to Istanbul if not to experience a different culture?) All this and three blocks to the Hippodrome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Markgranger
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Arena in early July, my family and i arrived by taxi from the airport and were greeted with complimentary drinks and cakes whilst we completed our obligitory paperwork. The Hotel is located just off the beaten track, a small walk away from the sites, the area is very typical old town Istanbul, narrow streets and rather hilly! The hotel management and staff were superb, they could not have offered more support, their suggestions for tours and guides were A1, they also spent time researching which hotels would offer their pool facilities for the day and at what cost, nothing was too much trouble. The hotel was very clean, the room extremely comfortable and well maintained, the food was fantastic. All in all, if you are travelling to Istanbul and want the feel of the real City, not a generic hotel chain, then the Arena is for you.

Reviews.Title: “A pre-cruise 3-day stay”
Reviews.Author: srk123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently completed a 3-day Istanbul stay prior to a cruise to Athens. Based on a referral from a friend who was also staying there, we tried the Arena. Very pleased. We paid for an upgraded room (Sultan's Corner) so we felt very comfortable. We had the room across from the previously-mentioned mosque, so we had our daily wake-up call at 4:30 am, which was irritating, but we lived with it, as we were then adjusting to a 10-hour time change from Pacific time. (My friend had a room on the other side of the hotel and also was awakened, so you can't escape this--the whole neighborhood is invited to pray 5 times a day from the loud speakers on the minarets of the mosque; management acknowledges this, but can't do anything about it). Breakfast (included in price) is very good and eating on the outdoor patio on a summer morning was a treat. Staff able to recommend restaurants and was good on delivering messages. As there are only 27 rooms, they tend to know everybody after a day. It's a short neighborhood walk to the tourist sights of the old city. A great change from the chain hotels. Yes, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Irritating, Part II”
Reviews.Author: paul_liza
Reviews.Content: We had a very bad experience with this hotel. For one, we were on the bottom floor at street level, so we not only had to endure noise of pedestrians and yelling children, but also the 5 AM call to prayer. The hotel wasn't full as far as we could tell, so our room assignment was a mystery. The air conditioning system was VERY hard to control and it was miserably hot most of the time even with the thermostat set to 5 degrees. We finally figured out that for the air conditioning to blow ANY cold air, you couldn't have the bathroom light/fan on. That makes a LOT of sense. Thanks for the heads up, staff. On top of this, whenever we left the room, they would turn our air off! The hotel has a hamam (15 euro) but if you go out for a few hours, the hamam comes to you for free! One consequence of this heat and humidity is that it made the room STINK. The bathroom was equally horrible. As already mentioned, the toilet seat is very thin and uncomfortable. The toilet flushing mechanism was a complete mystery. It usually took about 15 flushes before any paper would go down. And the bathroom door would not stay open on its own. The breakfast was very mediocre. We weren't always in the best mood when we had breakfast because we'd been up all night with the heat and noise, so we wanted to strangle whoever had it on Istanbul's TECHNO station at 8 AM. Furthermore, don't choose this hotel because it has wireless internet. Think of dialup speeds, but half the time it doesn't work at all. If you absolutely need to get online, the reception only seems good in the lobby. There were also little details which were annoying. For stationery, we had no pen, and one crinkled piece of paper. There were two nice silk flower arrangements on the bed upon our arrival, which we thought was nice, but upon closer inspection, noticed that they could be our very own for only 5 Euros. The beds were mediocre (asked for a double, got two beds pushed together), and we both woke up with mysterious bites on our arms and chest. One of its saving graces is the dinner. The service wasn't good, but the food was not bad. We recommend the Turkish soup. As you can tell, we would not recommend this hotel. The location is great and the staff is fairly friendly, but it's a small trade off for somewhere nicer and a bit further away. We stayed at the Armada Hotel a few days prior and recommend it over this atrocity.
